Name: Nicosia
Description: Nicosia is the capital of Cyprus and the last divided capital in Europe. Known for its historical architecture, cultural sites, and as the political and economic center of the country.

Name: Limassol
Description: Limassol is Cyprus second-largest city, a major port, and a hub for trade and tourism. Known for its beaches, festivals, and modern urban development.

Name: Larnaca
Description: Larnaca is a coastal city known for its historical landmarks, including ancient ruins and churches. It is also home to the islandâ€™s main international airport.

Name: Famagusta
Description: Famagusta is an eastern coastal region of Cyprus, famous for its ancient walled city, historical sites, and beautiful beaches. It is partially occupied by the Turkish Republic of Northern Cyprus.

Name: Paphos
Description: Paphos is a historic city on the southwestern coast of Cyprus, known for its ancient archaeological sites, including the Tombs of the Kings and Paphos Archaeological Park.

Name: Kyrenia
Description: Kyrenia is a picturesque coastal town in Northern Cyprus, known for its harbor, medieval castle, and scenic views along the Mediterranean coast.

Name: Morphou
Description: Morphou is a district located in the northwestern part of Cyprus, which is mainly known for its agricultural and rural areas. It is under the Turkish Republic of Northern Cyprus administration.

Name: Karpas
Description: Karpas is a remote and picturesque region on the northeastern tip of Cyprus. It is known for its natural beauty, including pristine beaches and mountainous terrain.

Name: Akhna
Description: Akhna is located in the southeastern part of Cyprus and is a rural area with a mix of agriculture and some light industry. It is under the administration of the Turkish Republic of Northern Cyprus.
